comments.text:
Need Help Navigating Medicare? 🩺 Don’t go it alone. Get expert guidance from those who know the system inside and out.
📞 Call Now: 352-841-0632 (Chapter Medicare)
💻 Get Help Online: https://bit.ly/Chapter_Medicare

RESOURCES & ADVOCACY
👤 Private 1-on-1 Consultation: Speak with a Former Social Security Insider.
Schedule here: https://24help.org/experts

Free Resource Hub: https://linktr.ee/MyGovExpert

Questions or Suggestions? Record a video message for us here: https://www.videoask.com/fmqmdblp6

comments.text: HI Dr. Ed.  In today's live you mentioned state of California Calpers employees don't pay into social security.  I retired last year and paid SS, as did my state agency.  The only ones that don't are firefighters, teachers, and peace officers.  Thanks

comments.text:
Got beat by my sister when I was 7. Worked until I 2012 when I was fully disabled then. Been taking care of my dad until he passed. 
I had to take care of the insurance as dad was incapable after the 2018 fire took their house.
Was suppose to get paid for working 24/7 for 2,219 days. Never got paid. Getting kicked out of the house we were suppose to split 50/50. Also Sister took me off the POD. I have taken care of dad, and I have nothing to live on as dad took care of the rent. Help.
comments.author: @harolddouglas5582

comments.text: I got some money from the 2018 Camp Fire and according to thw state congress, and federal congress. Because the money was for my lung damage, I read as it was a medical issue I didn’t have to claim for the money i recieved. I'm not rich, i apparently don't have a house, and i barely have a car.
comments.author: @harolddouglas5582

comments.text:
I've had to go on SSDI  IN FEB. 2021 Just before my 56th birthday that September. I have no clue what to expect in the next few years when I would be at retirement age. On a different live I heard you say it will automatically become retirement. Its increased with cola $1730.. waiting for the decision they gave me SSI and that got me Medicaid. 

SSI Stopped once SSDI Started and Medicaid stopped at 2 years became Medicare. The amount is what I've been providing for my family of 4. I learned last year that my school aged son can draw from my SSDI so I applied and they allotted him just over $800, a tremendous help! My wife is being deported not able to return for 10 years if granted . There's nothing on her side for SS benefits. My sons will end at 18 I think. They reduced the SNAP to $24 I assume because of what my son gets now. Should I be worried?
comments.author: @JohnPaulBrewer-cd5bo

comments.text: To get Tricare for Life I have to get Medicare parts A&B. Tricare will be my supplement plan. So very wrong that I do not get free medical for life because of Bill Clinton!

comments.text: I receive SSDI Under survival spouse benefit beginning at 60.  I was receiving SSI due to becoming disabled. I worked for many years but because I was a stay home for period and then became disabled I did not meet the # of months requirement i qualified for SSI.  Once I started receiving SSDI I was told my $2400 was the max I could receive, is this true?

comments.text:
I am going to be 62 yrs.old this year and was hoping to retire early, but I plan to live in the Philippines, so my early retirement SS will be enough.  Question. I was married to my X-husband for 23 years, we divorced in 2012,  he remarried in 2025.  I also remarried 2017.  My X-husband is turning 67 this year in June 16, and I would assume he is going to collect his Full SS benefit this year. 

Can I claim on his SS benefit, even though we are divorced?  

What other benefits can I claim feom his benefits, since we were marrried for a long time?  

Kindly help and advise!  Thank you!
comments.author: @THREEGEEZANDS
